entry.title: Teraura (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Pitcairn Islander Teraura (pictured) was one of "the most travelled Polynesian women" of her day?

entry.title: Mrs. Landingham (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the California State Assembly held a moment of silence over the death of fictional character Mrs. Landingham while in the midst of an energy crisis?

entry.title: Spotify Wrapped (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Spotify Wrapped has been both praised and criticized for effectively providing Spotify with free advertising?

entry.title: Daniel Fowle (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that in 1755, colonial printer Daniel Fowle was arrested for printing a seditious pamphlet entitled The Monster of Monsters, which criticized members of the general assembly?

entry.title: Lucerne School of Information Technology (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Guy Parmelin, now President of Switzerland, opened the study program of cyber security of the Lucerne School of Information Technology in 2018?

entry.title: Brewer Island (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that before Foster City was built on Brewer Island, unsuccessful proposals included a hog farm, two military air bases, two civilian airports, and an entertainment complex larger than Disneyland?

entry.title: Hugh Pettigrew (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that colonel Hugh Pettigrew observed that troops who thought that the Scottish Highlands resembled Waziristan on India's North West Frontier were "of little use to anyone"?

entry.title: The Anthropocene Reviewed (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that on his podcast The Anthropocene Reviewed, John Green reviews velociraptors, a hot dog stand in Iceland, and bubonic plague?
